name: ClosureMirror
comment:
A dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror reflects a closure.

A dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror provides access to its captured variables and provides the ability to execute its reflectee.

function.name: function
function.comment:
A mirror on the function associated with this closure.

The function associated with an implicit closure of a function is that function.

The function associated with an instance of a class that has a call method is that call method.

apply.name: apply
apply.comment: Executes the closure and returns a mirror on the result. Let f be the closure reflected by this mirror, let a1, ..., an be the elements of dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.apply.positionalArguments let k1, ..., km be the identifiers denoted by the elements of namedArguments.keys and let v1, ..., vm be the elements of namedArguments.values. Then this method will perform the method invocation f(a1, ..., an, k1: v1, ..., km: vm) If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.

findInContext.name: findInContext
findInContext.comment: Not yet supported. Calling this method throws an dart-core.UnsupportedError.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

type.name: type
type.comment:
A mirror on the type of the reflectee.

Returns a mirror on the actual class of the reflectee. The class of the reflectee may differ from the object returned by invoking dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.runtimeType on the reflectee.

hasReflectee.name: hasReflectee
hasReflectee.comment:
Does dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.reflectee contain the instance reflected by this mirror? This will always be true in the local case (reflecting instances in the same isolate), but only true in the remote case if this mirror reflects a simple value.

A value is simple if one of the following holds: - the value is null - the value is of type dart-core.num - the value is of type dart-core.bool - the value is of type dart-core.String

reflectee.name: reflectee
reflectee.comment:
If the dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror reflects an instance it is meaningful to have a local reference to, we provide access to the actual instance here.

If you access dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.reflectee when dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.hasReflectee is false, an exception is thrown.

==.comment: Returns true if this mirror is equal to dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.==.other. The equality holds if and only if (1) dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.==.other is a mirror of the same kind and (2) either (a) dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.hasReflectee is true and so is identical(reflectee, other.reflectee) or (b) the remote objects reflected by this mirror and by dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.==.other are identical.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

invoke.name: invoke
invoke.comment:
Invokes the named function and returns a mirror on the result.

Let o be the object reflected by this mirror, let f be the simple name of the member denoted by dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.invoke.memberName, let a1, ..., an be the elements of dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.invoke.positionalArguments let k1, ..., km be the identifiers denoted by the elements of namedArguments.keys and let v1, ..., vm be the elements of namedArguments.values. Then this method will perform the method invocation o.f(a1, ..., an, k1: v1, ..., km: vm) in a scope that has access to the private members of o (if o is a class or library) or the private members of the class of o (otherwise). If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.

getField.name: getField
getField.comment:
Invokes a getter and returns a mirror on the result. The getter can be the implicit getter for a field or a user-defined getter method.

Let o be the object reflected by this mirror, let f be the simple name of the getter denoted by dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.getField.fieldName, Then this method will perform the getter invocation o.f in a scope that has access to the private members of o (if o is a class or library) or the private members of the class of o (otherwise).

If this mirror is an dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror, and dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.getField.fieldName denotes an instance method on its reflectee, the result of the invocation is an instance mirror on a closure corresponding to that method.

If this mirror is a dart-mirrors.LibraryMirror, and dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.getField.fieldName denotes a top-level method in the corresponding library, the result of the invocation is an instance mirror on a closure corresponding to that method.

If this mirror is a dart-mirrors.ClassMirror, and dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.getField.fieldName denotes a static method in the corresponding class, the result of the invocation is an instance mirror on a closure corresponding to that method.

If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.

setField.name: setField
setField.comment:
Invokes a setter and returns a mirror on the result. The setter may be either the implicit setter for a non-final field or a user-defined setter method.

Let o be the object reflected by this mirror, let f be the simple name of the getter denoted by dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.setField.fieldName, and let a be the object bound to dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.setField.value. Then this method will perform the setter invocation o.f = a in a scope that has access to the private members of o (if o is a class or library) or the private members of the class of o (otherwise). If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.
